question: From the following table, select the option that correctly characterizes various phases of menstrual cycle:
choices: Menstruation phase: Menses | Follicular phase: L.H. Surge | Luteal phase: Regenration of endometrium
Menstruation phase: Matured follicle | Follicular phase: Regression of corpus luteum | Luteal phase: Ovulation
Menstruation phase: Regeneration of endometrium | Follicular phase: High level of progesterone | Luteal phase: Developing corpus luteum
Menstruation phase: Menses | Follicular phase: Developing corpus luteum | Luteal phase: Follicle maturation
explanation: The correct sequence involves: Menstruation characterized by Menses; The end of the Follicular phase is marked by the LH Surge; The Luteal phase involves the corpus luteum (though regeneration typically describes the proliferative/follicular phase, this option is the best fit among the choices provided in the source context).
